str2: Simeon or Simon. From the same as Simon; Symeon, the name of five Israelites.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
And, even, also, namely.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From dikaios; equity; specially justification.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
And, even, also, namely.
A savior, deliverer, preserver. From sozo; a deliverer, i.e. God or Christ.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb, which is only used as an alternate in certain tenses; to lot, i.e. Determine especially by lot.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
Equally privileged, equal in honor. From isos and time; of equal value or honor.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
